title: Nonideal behavior of butane at high pressure

content.question: Which of the following best explains the trend in the data as the volume decreases?

choices.label: The <math alttext="C 4 H 10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules decompose as the volume decreases, creating more moles of gas.

The volume of the <math alttext="C 4 H 10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules becomes more significant as the volume decreases.

The intermolecular forces between <math alttext="C 4 H 10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules become more significant as the volume decreases.

The average kinetic energy of the <math alttext="C 4 H 10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules decreases as the volume decreases.

content.answer: The intermolecular forces between <math alttext="C 4 H 10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> molecules become more significant as the volume decreases.

skill.text: 4.D: Explain the degree to which a model or representation describes the connection between particulate-level properties and macroscopic properties.
